user_request: A Christmas poem about the magic of the season and family togetherness.
final_poem:
The air is stitched with whispers of winter,  
A hush that hums beneath the stars,  
Where laughter spills from every corner,  
And time dissolves in shared hearts.  

The tree, a flame of tangled dreams,  
Bares secrets older than the snow,  
While cookies bake in golden silence,  
And carols weave through every door.  

Hands clasp warm as stories unfold—  
Of winters past, of paths once trod,  
Each face a map of love’s refrain,  
Each moment stitched in threads of gold.  

The world may spin in distant spheres,  
But here, the magic stays unbound—  
A chorus of the soul’s refrain,  
Where family and faith are found.
